section.title: Error Values
section.t: NFS error numbers are assigned to failed operations within a Compound (COMPOUND or CB_COMPOUND) request. A Compound request contains a number of NFS operations that have their results encoded in sequence in a Compound reply. The results of successful operations will consist of an NFS4_OK status followed by the encoded results of the operation. If an NFS operation fails, an error status will be entered in the reply and the Compound request will be terminated.

section.title: General Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors that are applicable to a broad set of different purposes.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADXDR (Error Code 10036)
section.t: The arguments for this operation do not match those specified in the XDR definition. This includes situations in which the request ends before all the arguments have been seen. Note that this error applies when fixed enumerations (these include booleans) have a value within the input stream which is not valid for the enum. A replier may pre-parse all operations for a Compound procedure before doing any operation execution and return RPC-level XDR errors in that case.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE (Error Code 10003)
section.t: Used for operations that provide a set of information indexed by some quantity provided by the client or cookie sent by the server for an earlier invocation. Where the value cannot be used for its intended purpose, this error results.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DELAY (Error Code 10008)
section.t: For any of a number of reasons, the replier could not process this operation in what was deemed a reasonable time. The client should wait and then try the request with a new slot and sequence value.

Some example of situations that might lead to this situation:
A server that supports hierarchical storage receives a request to process a file that had been migrated.
An operation requires a delegation recall to proceed and waiting for this delegation recall makes processing this request in a timely fashion impossible.

In such cases, the error NFS4ERR_DELAY allows these preparatory operations to proceed without holding up client resources such as a session slot. After delaying for period of time, the client can then re-send the operation in question (but not with the same slot ID and sequence ID; one or both MUST be different on the re-send).

Note that without the ability to return NFS4ERR_DELAY and the client's willingness to re-send when receiving it, deadlock might well result. E.g., if a recall is done, and if the delegation return or operations preparatory to delegation return are held up by other operations that need the delegation to be returned, session slots might not be available. The result could be deadlock.

section.title: NFS4ERR_INVAL (Error Code 22)
section.t: The arguments for this operation are not valid for some reason, even though they do match those specified in the XDR definition for the request.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOTSUPP (Error Code 10004)
section.t: Operation not supported, either because the operation is an OPTIONAL one and is not supported by this server or because the operation MUST NOT be implemented in the current minor version.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT (Error Code 10006)
section.t: An error occurred on the server which does not map to any of the specific legal NFSv4.1 protocol error values. The client should translate this into an appropriate error. UNIX clients may choose to translate this to EIO.

section.title: NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL (Error Code 10005)
section.t: Used where an operation returns a variable amount of data, with a limit specified by the client. Where the data returned cannot be fit within the limit specified by the client, this error results.

section.title: Filehandle Errors
section.t: These errors deal with the situation in which the current or saved filehandle, or the filehandle passed to PUTFH intended to become the current filehandle, is invalid in some way. This includes situations in which the filehandle is a valid filehandle in general but is not of the appropriate object type for the current operation.

Where the error description indicates a problem with the current or saved filehandle, it is to be understood that filehandles are only checked for the condition if they are implicit arguments of the operation in question.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE (Error Code 10001)
section.t: Illegal NFS filehandle for the current server. The current file handle failed internal consistency checks. Once accepted as valid (by PUTFH), no subsequent status change can cause the filehandle to generate this error.

section.title: NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED (Error Code 10014)
section.t: A current or saved filehandle which is an argument to the current operation is volatile and has expired at the server.

section.title: NFS4ERR_ISDIR (Error Code 21)
section.t: The current or saved filehandle designates a directory when the current operation does not allow a directory to be accepted as the target of this operation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_MOVED (Error Code 10019)
section.t: The file system which contains the current filehandle object is not present at the server. It may have been relocated, migrated to another server or may have never been present. The client may obtain the new file system location by obtaining the "fs_locations" or "fs_locations_info" attribute for the current filehandle. For further discussion, refer to

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE (Error Code 10020)
section.t: The logical current or saved filehandle value is required by the current operation and is not set. This may be a result of a malformed COMPOUND operation (i.e. no PUTFH or PUTROOTFH before an operation that requires the current filehandle be set).

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOTDIR (Error Code 20)
section.t: The current (or saved) filehandle designates an object which is not a directory for an operation in which a directory is required.

section.title: NFS4ERR_STALE (Error Code 70)
section.t: The current or saved filehandle value designating an argument to the current operation is invalid The file referred to by that filehandle no longer exists or access to it has been revoked.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SYMLINK (Error Code 10029)
section.t: The current filehandle designates a symbolic link when the current operation does not allow a symbolic link as the target.

section.title: NFS4ERR_WRONG_TYPE (Error Code 10083)
section.t: The current (or saved) filehandle designates an object which is of an invalid type for the current operation and there is no more specific error (such as NFS4ERR_ISDIR or NFS4ERR_SYMLINK) that applies. Note that in NFSv4.0, such situations generally resulted in the less specific error NFS4ERR_INVAL.

section.title: Compound Structure Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors that relate to overall structure of a Compound request (by which we mean to include both COMPOUND and CB_COMPOUND), rather than to particular operations.

There are a number of basic constraints on the operations that may appear in a Compound request. Sessions adds to these basic constraints by requiring a Sequence operation (either SEQUENCE or CB_SEQUENCE) at the start of the Compound.

section.title: NFS_OK (Error code 0)
section.t: Indicates the operation completed successfully, in that all of the constituent operations completed without error.

section.title: NFS4ERR_MINOR_VERS_MISMATCH (Error code 10021)
section.t: The minor version specified is not one that the current listener supports. This value is returned in the overall status for the Compound but is not associated with a specific operation since the results must specify a result count of zero.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOT_ONLY_OP (Error Code 10081)
section.t: Certain operations, which are allowed to be executed outside of a session, must be the only operation within a COMPOUND. This error results when that constraint is not met.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OP_ILLEGAL (Error Code 10044)
section.t: The operation code is not a valid one for the current Compound procedure. The opcode in the result stream matched with this error is the ILLEGAL value, although the value that appears in the request stream may be different. Where an illegal value appears and the replier pre-parses all operations for a Compound procedure before doing any operation execution, an RPC-level XDR error may be returned in this case.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OP_NOT_IN_SESSION (Error Code 10071)
section.t: Most forward operations and all callback operations are only valid within the context of a session, so that the Compound request in question must begin with a Sequence operation. If an attempt is made to execute these operations outside the context of session, this error results.

section.title: NFS4ERR_REP_TOO_BIG (Error Code 10066)
section.t: The reply to a Compound would exceed the channel's negotiated maximum response size.

section.title: NFS4ERR_REP_TOO_BIG_TO_CACHE (Error Code 10067)
section.t: The reply to a Compound would exceed the channel's negotiated maximum size for replies cached in the reply cache when the Sequence for the current request specifies that this request is to be cached.

section.title: NFS4ERR_REQ_TOO_BIG (Error Code 10065)
section.t: The Compound request exceeds the channel's negotiated maximum size for requests.

section.title: NFS4ERR_RETRY_UNCACHED_REP (Error Code 10068)
section.t: The requester has attempted a retry of a Compound which it previously requested not be placed in the reply cache.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SEQUENCE_POS (Error Code 10064)
section.t: A Sequence operation appeared in a position other than the first operation of a Compound request.

section.title: NFS4ERR_TOO_MANY_OPS (Error Code 10070)
section.t: The Compound request has too many operations, exceeding the count negotiated when the session was created.

section.title: NFS4ERR_UNSAFE_COMPOUND (Error Code 10068)
section.t: The client has sent a COMPOUND request with an unsafe mix of operations, specifically with a non-idempotent operation changing the current filehandle which is not followed by a GETFH.

section.title: File System Errors
section.t: These errors describe situations which occurred in the underlying file system implementation rather than in the protocol or any NFSv4.x feature.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADTYPE (Error Code 10007)
section.t: An attempt was made to create an object with an inappropriate type specified to CREATE. This may be because the type is undefined, because it is a type not supported by the server, or because it is a type for which create is not intended such as a regular file or named attribute, for which OPEN is used to do the file creation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DQUOT (Error Code 19)
section.t: Resource (quota) hard limit exceeded. The user's resource limit on the server has been exceeded.

section.title: NFS4ERR_EXIST (Error Code 17)
section.t: A file of the specified target name (when creating, renaming or linking) already exists.

section.title: NFS4ERR_FBIG (Error Code 27)
section.t: File too large. The operation would have caused a file to grow beyond the server's limit.

section.title: NFS4ERR_FILE_OPEN (Error Code 10046)
section.t: The operation is not allowed because a file involved in the operation is currently open. Servers may, but are not required to disallow linking-to, removing, or renaming open files.

section.title: NFS4ERR_IO (Error Code 5)
section.t: Indicates that an I/O error occurred for which the file system was unable to provide recovery.

section.title: NFS4ERR_MLINK (Error Code 31)
section.t: The request would have caused the server's limit for the number of hard links a file may have to be exceeded.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOENT (Error Code 2)
section.t: Indicates no such file or directory. The file or directory name specified does not exist.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOSPC (Error Code 28)
section.t: Indicates no space left on device. The operation would have caused the server's file system to exceed its limit.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOTEMPTY (Error Code 66)
section.t: An attempt was made to remove a directory that was not empty.

section.title: NFS4ERR_ROFS (Error Code 30)
section.t: Indicates a read-only file system. A modifying operation was attempted on a read-only file system.

section.title: NFS4ERR_XDEV (Error Code 18)
section.t:
Indicates an attempt to do an operation, such as linking, that inappropriately crosses a boundary. This may be due to such boundaries as:
That between file systems (where the fsids are different).
That between different named attribute directories or between a named attribute directory and an ordinary directory.
That between regions of a file system that the file system implementation treats as separate (for example for space accounting purposes), and where cross-connection between the regions are not allowed.

section.title: State Management Errors
section.t: These errors indicate problems with the stateid (or one of the stateids) passed to a given operation. This includes situations in which the stateid is invalid as well as situations in which the stateid is valid but designates revoked locking state. Depending on the operation, the stateid when valid may designate opens, byte-range locks, file or directory delegations, layouts, or device maps.

section.title: NFS4ERR_ADMIN_REVOKED (Error Code 10047)
section.t: A stateid designates locking state of any type that has been revoked due to administrative interaction, possibly while the lease is valid.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID (Error Code 10026)
section.t:
A stateid does not properly designate any valid state. See and
for a discussion of how stateids are validated.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DELEG_REVOKED (Error Code 10087)
section.t: A stateid designates recallable locking state of any type that has been revoked due to the failure of the client to return the lock, when it was recalled.

section.title: NFS4ERR_EXPIRED (Error Code 10011)
section.t: A stateid designates locking state of any type that has been revoked due to expiration of the client's lease, either immediately upon lease expiration, or following a later request for a conflicting lock.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OLD_STATEID (Error Code 10024)
section.t: A stateid with a non-zero seqid value does match the current seqid for the state designated by the user.

section.title: Security Errors
section.t: These are the various permission-related errors in NFSv4.1.

section.title: NFS4ERR_ACCESS (Error Code 13)
section.t: Indicates permission denied. The caller does not have the correct permission to perform the requested operation. Contrast this with NFS4ERR_PERM (), which restricts itself to owner or privileged user permission failures, and NFS4ERR_WRONG_CRED () which deals with appropriate permission to delete or modify transient objects, based on the credentials of the user that created them.

section.title: NFS4ERR_PERM (Error Code 1)
section.t: Indicates requester is not the owner. The operation was not allowed because the caller is neither a privileged user (root) nor the owner of the target of the operation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC (Error Code 10016)
section.t: Indicates that the security mechanism being used by the client for the operation does not match the server's security policy. The client should change the security mechanism being used and re-send the operation (but not with the same slot ID and sequence ID; one or both MUST be different on the re-send). SECINFO and SECINFO_NO_NAME can be used to determine the appropriate mechanism.

section.title: NFS4ERR_WRONG_CRED (Error Code 10082)
section.t: An operation manipulating state was attempted by a principal that was not allowed to modify that piece of state.

section.title: Name Errors
section.t: Names in NFSv4 are UTF-8 strings. When the strings are not valid UTF-8 or are of length zero, the error NFS4ERR_INVAL results. Besides this, there are a number of other errors to indicate specific problems with names.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADCHAR (Error Code 10040)
section.t: A UTF-8 string contains a character which is not supported by the server in the context in which it being used.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADNAME (Error Code 10041)
section.t: A name string in a request consisted of valid UTF-8 characters supported by the server but the name is not supported by the server as a valid name for current operation. An example might be creating a file or directory named ".." on a server whose file system uses that name for links to parent directories.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NAMETOOLONG (Error Code 63)
section.t: Returned when the filename in an operation exceeds the server's implementation limit.

section.title: Locking Errors
section.t: This section deal with errors related to locking, both as to share reservations and byte-range locking. It does not deal with errors specific to the process of reclaiming locks. Those are dealt with in the next section.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_RANGE (Error Code 10042)
section.t: The range for a LOCK, LOCKT, or LOCKU operation is not appropriate to the allowable range of offsets for the server. E.g., this error results when a server which only supports 32-bit ranges receives a range that cannot be handled by that server. (See ).

section.title: NFS4ERR_DEADLOCK (Error Code 10045)
section.t: The server has been able to determine a file locking deadlock condition for a blocking lock request.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DENIED (Error Code 10010)
section.t: An attempt to lock a file is denied. Since this may be a temporary condition, the client is encouraged to re-send the lock request (but not with the same slot ID and sequence ID; one or both MUST be different on the re-send) until the lock is accepted. See for a discussion of the re-send.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LOCKED (Error Code 10012)
section.t:
A read or write operation was attempted on a file where there was a conflict between the I/O and an existing lock:
There is a share reservation inconsistent with the I/O being done.
The range to be read or written intersects an existing mandatory byte range lock.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LOCKS_HELD (Error Code 10037)
section.t: An operation was prevented by the unexpected presence of locks.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LOCK_NOTSUPP (Error Code 10043)
section.t: A locking request was attempted which would require the upgrade or downgrade of a lock range already held by the owner when the server does not support atomic upgrade or downgrade of locks.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LOCK_RANGE (Error Code 10028)
section.t: A lock request is operating on a range that overlaps in part a currently held lock for the current lock owner and does not precisely match a single such lock where the server does not support this type of request, and thus does not implement POSIX locking semantics. See , , and for a discussion of how this applies to LOCK, LOCKT, and LOCKU respectively.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OPENMODE (Error Code 10038)
section.t: The client attempted a READ, WRITE, LOCK or other operation not sanctioned by the stateid passed (e.g. writing to a file opened only for read).

section.title: NFS4ERR_SHARE_DENIED (Error Code 10015)
section.t: An attempt to OPEN a file with a share reservation has failed because of a share conflict.

section.title: Reclaim Errors
section.t: These errors relate to the process of reclaiming locks after a server restart.

section.title: NFS4ERR_COMPLETE_ALREADY (Error Code 10054)
section.t: The client previously sent a successful RECLAIM_COMPLETE operation. An additional RECLAIM_COMPLETE operation is not necessary and results in this error.

section.title: NFS4ERR_GRACE (Error Code 10013)
section.t: The server is in its recovery or grace period which should at least match the lease period of the server. A locking request other than a reclaim could not be granted during that period.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NO_GRACE (Error Code 10033)
section.t: A reclaim of client state was attempted in circumstances in which the server cannot guarantee that conflicting state has not been provided to another client. This can occur because the reclaim has been done outside of the grace period of the server, after the client has done a RECLAIM_COMPLETE operation, or because previous operations have created a situation in which the server is not able to determine that a reclaim-interfering edge condition does not exist.

section.title: NFS4ERR_RECLAIM_BAD (Error Code 10034)
section.t: A reclaim attempted by the client does not match the server's state consistency checks and has been rejected therefore as invalid.

section.title: NFS4ERR_RECLAIM_CONFLICT (Error Code 10035)
section.t: The reclaim attempted by the client has encountered a conflict and cannot be satisfied. Potentially indicates a misbehaving client, although not necessarily the one receiving the error. The misbehavior might be on the part of the client that established the lock with which this client conflicted.

section.title: pNFS Errors
section.t: This section deals with pNFS-related errors including those that are associated with using NFSv4.1 to communicate with a data server.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADIOMODE (Error Code 10049)
section.t: An invalid or inappropriate layout iomode was specified.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADLAYOUT (Error Code 10050)
section.t: The layout specified is invalid in some way. For LAYOUTCOMMIT, this indicates that the specified layout is not held by the client or is not of mode LAYOUTIOMODE4_RW. For LAYOUTGET, it indicates that a layout matching the client's specification as to minimum length cannot be granted.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LAYOUTTRYLATER (Error Code 10058)
section.t: Layouts are temporarily unavailable for the file. The client should re-send later (but not with the same slot ID and sequence ID; one or both MUST be different on the re-send).

section.title: NFS4ERR_LAYOUTUNAVAILABLE (Error Code 10059)
section.t: Returned when layouts are not available for the current file system or the particular specified file.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOMATCHING_LAYOUT (Error Code 10060)
section.t: Returned when layouts are recalled and the client has no layouts matching the specification of the layouts being recalled.

section.title: NFS4ERR_PNFS_IO_HOLE (Error Code 10075)
section.t: The pNFS client has attempted to read from or write to an illegal hole of a file of a data server that is using sparse packing. See .

section.title: NFS4ERR_PNFS_NO_LAYOUT (Error Code 10080)
section.t: The pNFS client has attempted to read from or write to a file (using a request to a data server) without holding a valid layout. This includes the case where the client had a layout, but the iomode does not allow a WRITE.

section.title: NFS4ERR_RETURNCONFLICT (Error Code 10086)
section.t: A layout is unavailable due to an attempt to perform the LAYOUTGET before a pending LAYOUTRETURN on the file has been received. See .

section.title: NFS4ERR_UNKNOWN_LAYOUTTYPE (Error Code 10062)
section.t: The client has specified a layout type which is not supported by the server.

section.title: Session Use Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors encountered in using sessions, that is, in issuing requests over them using the Sequence (i.e. either SEQUENCE or CB_SEQUENCE) operations.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADSESSION (Error Code 10052)
section.t: A session ID was specified which does not exist.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADSLOT (Error Code 10053)
section.t: The requester sent a Sequence operation that attempted to use a slot the replier does not have in its slot table. It is possible the slot may have been retired.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_HIGH_SLOT (Error Code 10077)
section.t: The highest_slot argument in a Sequence operation exceeds the replier's enforced highest_slotid.

section.title: NFS4ERR_CB_PATH_DOWN (Error Code 10048)
section.t: There is a problem contacting the client via the callback path. The function of this error has been mostly superseded by the use of status flags in the reply to the SEQUENCE operation (see ).

section.title: NFS4ERR_DEADSESSION (Error Code 10078)
section.t: The specified session is a persistent session which is dead and does not accept new requests or perform new operations on existing requests (in the case in which a request was partially executed before server restart).

section.title: NFS4ERR_CONN_NOT_BOUND_TO_SESSION (Error Code 10055)
section.t: A Sequence operation was sent on a connection that has not been associated with the specified session, where the client specified that connection association was to be enforced with SP4_MACH_CRED or SP4_SSV state protection.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SEQ_FALSE_RETRY (Error Code 10076)
section.t: The requester sent a Sequence operation with a slot ID and sequence ID that are in the reply cache, but the replier has detected that the retried request is not the same as the original request.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SEQ_MISORDERED (Error Code 10063)
section.t: The requester sent a Sequence operation with an invalid sequence ID.

section.title: Session Management Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors associated with requests used in session management.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BACK_CHAN_BUSY (Error Code 10057)
section.t: An attempt was made to destroy a session when the session cannot be destroyed because the server has callback requests outstanding.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_SESSION_DIGEST (Error Code 10051)
section.t: The digest used in a SET_SSV request is not valid.

section.title: Client Management Errors
section.t: This sections deals with errors associated with requests used to create and manage client IDs.

section.title: NFS4ERR_CLIENTID_BUSY (Error Code 10074)
section.t: The DESTROY_CLIENTID operation has found there are sessions and/or unexpired state associated with the client ID to be destroyed.

section.title: NFS4ERR_CLID_INUSE (Error Code 10017)
section.t: While processing an EXCHANGE_ID operation, the server was presented with a co_ownerid field matches an existing client with valid leased state but the principal issuing the EXCHANGE_ID is different than that establishing the existing client. This indicates a (most likely due to chance) collision between clients. The client should recover by changing the co_ownerid and re-sending EXCHANGE_ID (but not with the same slot ID and sequence ID; one or both MUST be different on the re-send).

section.title: NFS4ERR_ENCR_ALG_UNSUPP (Error Code 10079)
section.t: An EXCHANGE_ID was sent which specified state protection via SSV, and where the set of encryption algorithms presented by the client did not include any supported by the server.

section.title: NFS4ERR_HASH_ALG_UNSUPP (Error Code 10072)
section.t: An EXCHANGE_ID was sent which specified state protection via SSV, and where the set of hashing algorithms presented by the client did not include any supported by the server.

section.title: NFS4ERR_STALE_CLIENTID (Error Code 10022)
section.t: A client ID not recognized by the server was passed to an operation. Note that unlike the case of NFSv4.0, client IDs are not passed explicitly to the server in ordinary locking operations and cannot result in this error. Instead, when there is a server restart, it is first manifested through an error on the associated session and the staleness of the client ID is detected when trying to associate a client ID with a new session.

section.title: Delegation Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors associated with requesting and returning delegations.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DELEG_ALREADY_WANTED (Error Code 10056)
section.t: The client has requested a delegation when it had already registered that it wants that same delegation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_DIRDELEG_UNAVAIL (Error Code 10084)
section.t: This error is returned when the server is unable or unwilling to provide a requested directory delegation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_RECALLCONFLICT (Error Code 10061)
section.t: A recallable object (i.e. a layout or delegation) is unavailable due to a conflicting recall operation for that object that is currently in progress.

section.title: NFS4ERR_REJECT_DELEG (Error Code 10085)
section.t: The callback operation invoked to deal with a new delegation has rejected it.

section.title: Attribute Handling Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors specific to attribute handling within NFSv4.

section.title: NFS4ERR_ATTRNOTSUPP (Error Code 10032)
section.t: An attribute specified is not supported by the server. This error MUST NOT be returned by the GETATTR operation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADOWNER (Error Code 10039)
section.t: Returned when an owner or owner_group attribute value or the who field of an ace within an ACL attribute value cannot be translated to a local representation.

section.title: NFS4ERR_NOT_SAME (Error Code 10027)
section.t: This error is returned by the VERIFY operation to signify that the attributes compared were not the same as those provided in the client's request.

section.title: NFS4ERR_SAME (Error Code 10009)
section.t: This error is returned by the NVERIFY operation to signify that the attributes compared were the same as those provided in the client's request.

section.title: Obsoleted Errors
section.t:
These errors MUST NOT be generated by any NFSv4.1 operation. This can be for a number of reasons.
The function provided by the error has been superseded by one of the status bits returned by the SEQUENCE operation.
The new session structure and associated change in locking have made the error unnecessary.
There has been a restructuring of some errors for NFSv4.1 which resulted in the elimination of certain of the errors.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BAD_SEQID (Error Code 10026)
section.t: The sequence number (seqid) in a locking request is neither the next expected number or the last number processed. These seqids are ignored in NFSv4.1.

section.title: NFS4ERR_LEASE_MOVED (Error Code 10031)
section.t: A lease being renewed is associated with a file system that has been migrated to a new server. The error has been superseded by the SEQ4_STATUS_LEASE_MOVED status bit (see ).

section.title: NFS4ERR_NXIO (Error Code 5)
NFS4ERR_RESTOREFH (Error Code 10030)
section.t: The RESTOREFH operation does not have a saved filehandle (identified by SAVEFH) to operate upon. In NFSv4.1, this error has been superseded by NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE.

section.title: NFS4ERR_STALE_STATEID (Error Code 10023)
section.t: A stateid generated by an earlier server instance was used. This error is moot in NFSv4.1 because all operations that take a stateid MUST be preceded by the SEQUENCE operation, and the earlier server instance is detected by the session infrastructure that supports SEQUENCE.

section.title: Operations and their valid errors
section.t:
This section contains a table which gives the valid error returns for each protocol operation. The error code NFS4_OK (indicating no error) is not listed but should be understood to be returnable by all operations with two important exceptions:
The operations which MUST NOT be implemented: OPEN_CONFIRM, RELEASE_LOCKOWNER, RENEW, SETCLIENTID, and SETCLIENTID_CONFIRM.
The invalid operation: ILLEGAL.

section.title: Callback operations and their valid errors
section.t: This section contains a table which gives the valid error returns for each callback operation. The error code NFS4_OK (indicating no error) is not listed but should be understood to be returnable by all callback operations with the exception of CB_ILLEGAL.
